Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 04:51AM Babsplus5 wrote: I'm pulling  for you.  Don't kick yourself about drinking, your're way too young for that to have a big impact. My understanding is that it affects how the liver processes your hormones and I just don't think at your age you could have done that much damage.  I'm 48 and hoping to get my biopsy results today.  I have totally been agonizing over alcohol consumption, definitely too much over the past 2 years so I have promised myself that It stops immediately.  Good luck to you, please let us know how it turns out.
Posts.Title: 26 years old, had a biopsy yesterday (10/3/11) das_madchen beacon800
Rollercoaster waiting for surgical biopsy results Babsplus5 momoftwoboys

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2011 12:38PM Babsplus5 wrote: Thanks Beacon800- My path report doesn't mention margins but it does say that the tissue was 3 cm X 4 cm and the surgeon noted that it was a difficult, tedious dissection.  I will feel much better when I get the 2nd opinion.  How did you find out you were ER+/PR+, HER2-?  Are you doing Tamoxifen and high surveillance or PBMX?  I see alot of women on these boards seem to do the PBMX but my surgeon was totally against it.
Posts.Title: Rollercoaster waiting for surgical biopsy results Babsplus5 momoftwoboys

Posts.Content: Babsplus5 wrote: Had a surgical biopsy on Friday, Sept 30th after core biopsy came back as suspicious for a lobular neoplasm.  Prior mammo was a Birad 4.  Although I know that these factors are in my favor, I'm still a mess waiting for the pathology report.  Has anyone had a core biopsy with a somewhat favorable result and then had the surgical biopsy come back as invasive cancer? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Rollercoaster waiting for surgical biopsy results Babsplus5 momoftwoboys

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2011 11:36AM Babsplus5 wrote: Hi Gang: I received a diagnosis of LCIS from my very unpleasant surgeon who spoke to me like I was 8 years old.  Anyway, although I am happy to hear this news, I'm concerned that there could be some other cells that are cancerous lurking around.  He refused to do an MRI because that could "open up a can of worms" as far as false positives. I am not happy with just a wait and see approach without some further testing now.  I am taking all of my medical records and my slides to a comprehensive breast center for a second opinion.  Has anyone ever had a second opinion and found out that the first was incorrect?
Posts.Title: Rollercoaster waiting for surgical biopsy results Babsplus5 momoftwoboys

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 12:30PM Babsplus5 wrote: So sorry about your news.  I am hoping to get the results of my surgical biopsy today or tomorrow.  I don't remember feeling that the mood in the room changed during my core needle biopsy but when my doctor spoke to me after my surgery on friday, he said i was a tough case because I had a lot of blood vessels in there.  This comment worries me but I am trying to stay positive.  How old are your children and how are they handling the news?
Posts.Title: Hoping for the best is hard... PhunkyM Babsplus5
